articles.description: Masters champion and world number three Jon Rahm confirms he is making a shock move to join LIV Golf.
articles.title: Masters champion Rahm confirms switch to LIV Golf

articles.description: As he lay in a hospital bed recovering from a stroke, Matt Crossen was prepared for the physical battle to return to the football pitch. The mental challenge was more of a surprise.
articles.title: 'If I didn't have my stroke, would I be playing for England?’

articles.description: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min says his team-mates "need to take responsibility" as they drop points from a winning position again.
articles.title: Latest Spurs defeat 'unacceptable' - Son

articles.description: Everton climb out of the relegation zone just 20 days after being plunged into it, as Sean Dyche praises the team's mentality and connection.
articles.title: Everton out of bottom three 'psychologically massive'

articles.description: Erik ten Hag says friends tried to talk him out of taking over as Manchester United manager because they thought he faced an "impossible job".
articles.title: 'Friends tried to talk me out of Man Utd job' - Ten Hag

articles.description: West Ham United continue their fine run of form as a second-half comeback helps David Moyes' side stun Tottenham in the Premier League.
articles.title: Spurs winless run goes on after West Ham comeback

articles.description: Formula 1's governing body ends its compliance inquiry into Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff and F1 Academy director Susie Wolff.
articles.title: FIA ends controversial inquiry into Toto and Susie Wolff

articles.description: Manchester United listen to offers for Casemiro, Spurs eye Everton's Jarrad Branthwaite, Arsenal keen on Joao Palhinha, plus more.
articles.title: Man Utd open to Casemiro, Varane and Sancho offers - Friday's gossip

articles.description: A stoppage-time goal condemns Santos, Brazil legend Pele's former club, to their first relegation from the top flight.
articles.title: Pele's former club Santos relegated for first time

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu will make her comeback to the tennis tour in Auckland in the first week of January.
articles.title: Raducanu to make comeback in Auckland in January
